CSS is a classic.

Достоинства:
Интерфейс, карты, оружие!
Недостатки:
Нет.
Всем привет и доброго времени суток! Сегодня поделюсь своим впечатлением от игры Counter-Strike: Source или как её часто называют CSS.

CSS это многопользовательская online игра, в которую можно играть со своими лучшими друзьями. Действие игры происходит от первого лица. Смысл в том что есть две команды и каждая из них должна уничтожить игроков другой команды. Есть небольшие вариации в зависимости от режимов игры, но общий смысл всегда остаётся прежним. Команды разделяются на террористов и контр террористов, то есть представителей силовых структур. 

В зависимости от того, сколько человек играет можно выбирать и карту. Чем больше карта, тем больше она вмещает людей.

Оружия в игре хватает в полном объёме. Условно говоря, в игре представлены самые популярные образцы стрелкового оружия в мире. Я же предпочитаю снайперскую винтовку, поскольку даже в ближнем бою одного точного выстрела в голову хватает для убийства противника.

 Big UP!!!RECOMAND!!!!

This will probably stay my favourite CS installment forever. It's weird how newer CS players are looking back at Source/CZ/1.6 and hardly can understand the appeal anymore. The recent search algorithm shifts on YouTube also pretty much buried the majority of gameplay footage, frag movies, fun videos, machinimas or clan war recordings from that time in favour of todays popular YouTubers going "back in time". Ironic, heh. Source had mind-blowing graphics and ragdoll physics when it was released. And it was very impressive just how many different people gathered in and played CS:S together.

Some people describe this game as easy when comparing it to GO. Mostly because of the higher gun accuracy, both when standing or in movement. The game was also faster in general and spray patterns where nowhere near as dominant. Making it easier to aim at and hit your enemy. But these rules applied to your opponent as well, making the experience very fast-paced and reflex-depended. More akin to classical deathmatch games. Also different tactics and playstyles have been used to adopt to the different gameplay. Corner peaks back and forth from cover at full running speed i.e. were very effective.

But what really earned this game a special place in my heart was its community and custom gamemode scene. Surf with actual deathmatch instead of solo high score chases, GunGame on special maps, PropHunt, Zombie Survival and Escape, Slide, Jailbreak, destructible environments. Or simply maps offering a very unique concept, i.e. glass_war. There also was a RPG server plugin where you would gain EXP for kills and level certain abilities like HP regeneration, jump distance, self-heal when dealing damage, pistol frost ammo slowing down enemies, and other interesting stuff. Was complementing certain servers very well.

Other CS:S players might list entirely different gamemodes. There was something for every taste and playing these wasn't niche or hidden away in a specific Community browser. In fact there was only one server browser and no official servers (except for a few in the US). It was all about the community's self-initiative and having easy access to all tools neccesary for running servers, creating content and building a good reputation/player base. It was this freedom and competition between servers that lead to said abundance of popular and unique high-quality gamemodes, server plugins as well as maps. The majority of players were regularly or even primarily playing these and it was a really great time overall. :)

CS:S Самая первая игра вообще  в которую я поиграл в онлайне впервые.

CS:S По идее ничем не отличается от CS:1.6, потому её называют "Самой худшей частью КС", кто-то даже обозвал её "Провалом", но я так не скажу.В основном такая предвзятость была именно из-за того что, она "Ничем не отличалась от CS:1.6". Докукарекались? Вот вам CS:GO. Теперь соурс - шедевр игровой индустрии.

Ладно, ушёл от темы.

Что можно про неё рассказать? Изменена физика гранат (В лучшую сторону). Не стрёмные модельки и т.д.

Плюсы:
+ Алекватное (Иногда нет) комьюнити
+ Имбовые дуалы (Луна.png)
+ Возможность выбрать модельку игрока. (Ну типа для игры с другом найс бонус.)

Минусы:
- Привыкание к свету. Когда заходишь на лонг на de_dust2 после темноты на экране творить орехнительная мыльное пати. От этого аж глаза на лоб выходят, и тебя убивают. Это уже оссобенность движка.
- Оптимизация. Как бы ни рыбо не мясо. Иногда может проседать. Это огорчает.

Итог: 8/10
Timeless!  Years later this game is still a joy to play!

While CSS and CSGO are both great games and I don't see no reason as to why you shouldn't buy Counter Strike Source, I would like to point out the pros and cons of CSS (At least based on MY thoughts and preferences) while comparing it with CSGO to help you decide which one you should buy.

Pros:
1.Lets get this one out of the way. Definitely feels way more fun than CSGO in general.
2.Gunplay plays out smoother and the recoil of the weapons plays a big part on that. (CSS has random recoil while CSGO has preset recoil for each weapon)
3.Customizable...A LOT. With a little basic knowledge of the engine, you can add your own custom models, materials, sounds, etc etc. And even some new modes using sourcemod or other plugins. (Sure as hell beats CSGO's skins, which are paid...)
4.More variety on custom servers (DM, Surf, Zombie, Zombie escape, etc)
5.Its rather more casual than competitive, which is what I prefer.
6.Better bots (In my opinion and experience)
7.Less toxic community (Including kids, russians etc), but that doesn't mean its toxic free! (All the wankers moved on to CSGO)
8.You can tweak your server settings when starting a map, rather than starting a match with preset settings, and having to fiddle with the console.
9.Hitboxes, while they are a bit big and got some complaints, I feel like they fit right in the game and are way more responsive than CSGO's hitboxes.
10.Snipers feel damn fine to use in this game
11.No CZ 75, No R8, No Mag 7, No Sawn off, No negev, No tec 9 etc etc. CSS has the original weapons from CS 1.6 and thats it. (This includes the fact that there is one M4, instead of CSGO, which has 2)
12.Guns are tweaked just about right. Each one feels balanced and deserves the stats that it has.Not too OP, and not too shit. Yeah, even the glock, believe it or not.
13.Suprisingly, less hackers.
14.I think the maps in CSS are more fun to play, rather than CSGO variants.
15.Gamebanana and other sites have a gigantic collection of custom maps for the game.
16.No weapon skins. (Instead you can get a buttload of cool custom models and reskins)

Cons:
1.Less active community than CSGO.
2.Servers with "premium" features (Only Premium users have access to AWP, Auto sniper, have 150 health etc etc) are common.
3.No official servers like CSGO. (Most servers will be in a way or another, modified and not vanilla, at least the ones with players in it)
4.66 tick servers.
5.Graphics are a bit dated.
6.No lobby system.
7.No matchmaking.
8.Hostages can be killed, which can lead to exploits (Although hostage killers do get punished so its not common to kill hostages)
9.Wallbanging is drastically reduced and less effective

In conclusion, I think Counter Strike Source is a better game than CSGO. Hell! I think its the best in the series.
If you're a casual player like me, you should get this. If you like competitive, I think CSGO is your choice (Although you can find clans who host competitive matches in CSS, which are awesome)
